source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_018_chunk1
evidence_span: Thin-walled Zircaloy-2 tubes containing an axial weld do not reach their full strength because they always fail prematurely in the weld when pressurized to failure in a fixed-end burst test.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_018_chunk1
evidence_span: Reinforcing the weld by increasing its thickness by 25% moves the failure to the parent metal and improves the biaxial strength of the tube by 20 to 25% and increases the total elongation by 200 to 450%.
